text2: The intention for 2 rak'ah sunnah: “I intend to pray two rak'ah Sunnah of Isha facing the qibla for Allah, the Great.” The rest will continue in the same way as the 2 rak'ah of Fajr
title: Finish

text1:
The Witr (odd number) prayer is extra prayers that the Prophet practiced and highly encouraged Muslims to practice as well. He (pbuh) never left it even when traveling.  You can offer Witr prayers anytime after ‘Isha’ until the time for Fajr prayer. You may choose to pray one, three, five, seven, or nine Rak’ahs.

Is witr prayer obligatory or sunnah?

Witr prayer is one of the greatest acts of worship that draw one closer to Allah. Some of the scholars – the Hanafis – even thought that it is one of the obligatory prayers, but the correct view is that it is one of the confirmed Sunnahs (Sunnah muakkadah) which the Muslim should observe regularly and not neglect.

Imam Ahmad (may Allah have mercy on him) said: Whoever neglects Witr is a bad man whose testimony should not be accepted. This indicates that Witr prayer is something that is confirmed.

We may sum up the manner of offering Witr prayer as follows:

Time of witr prayer

The witr prayer starts when a person has prayed ‘Isha, even if it is joined to Maghrib at the time of Maghrib, and lasts until dawn begins , because the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “Allah has prescribed for you a prayer (by which He may increase your reward), which is Witr; Allah has enjoined it for you during the time between ‘Isha prayer until dawn begins.” (Narrated by al-Tirmidhi, 425; classed as saheeh by al-Albani in Sahih al-Tirmidhi)

Is it better to offer witr prayer at the beginning of its time or to delay it?
The Sunnah indicates that if a person thinks he will be able to get up at the end of the night, it is better to delay it , because prayer at the end of the night is better and is witnessed (by the angels).

But whoever fears that he will not get up at the end of the night should pray Witr before he goes to sleep, because of the hadith of Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “Whoever fears that he will not get up at the end of the night, let him pray Witr at the beginning of the night, but whoever thinks that he will be able to get up at the end of the night, let him pray Witr at the end of the night, for prayer at the end of the night is witnessed (by the angels) and that is better.” (Narrated by Muslim, 755)

Al-Nawawi said:

“This is the correct view. Other ahadith which speak of this topic in general terms are to be interpreted in the light of this sound, specific and clear report, such as the hadith, “My close friend advised me not to sleep without having prayed Witr.” This is to be understood as referring to one who is not sure that he will be able to wake up (to pray Witr at the end of the night).” (Sharh Muslim, 3/277)

Number of rak’ahs in witr prayer

The minimum number of rak’ahs for Witr is one rak’ah, because the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “Witr is one rak'ah at the end of the night.” (Narrated by Muslim, 752)

And he (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “The night prayers are two (rak’ahs) by two, but if one of you fears that dawn is about to break, let him pray one rak’ah to make what he has prayed odd-numbered.” (Narrated by al-Bukhari, 911; Muslim, 749)

If a person limits himself to praying one rak’ah, then he has performed the Sunnah. But Witr may also be three or five or seven or nine.
title: About Witr wajib

text1:
The following is the complete method of performing a 3 Raka'ah Witr wajib prayer:

Make the intention “I intend to pray three rak'ah Witr wajib facing the qibla for Allah, the Great.”

Saying it in the heart is sufficient.
title: Niyyah (Intention)

text1: Raise hands to the shoulders with palms facing the Qibla and say “Allahu Akbar” (Allah is the Greatest)
title: First takbir

text1:
Do the Qiyam by lowering the hands down and folding them on the chest

This is done by placing the right palm on the back of the left palm.

Read the Sanaa and Recite Surah Fatiha:
text2: After Fatiha, recite any small surah or verses from the Qur’an. For example:
title: Qiyam

text1: Say “Allahu Akbar” and go into Ruku (bowing). In Ruku recite the following 3 times: Subhaana Rabbiyal ‘Azeem (Glory be to my Lord, The Greatest)
text2: In ruku fingers of both hands should be together and placed on the knees. The arms should be well joined to the sides and the ankles of both feet should be together. A woman should only bow to the extent that their hands reach the knees.
title: Ruku (Bowing)

text1:
Afterwards, stand up in Qawmah position while reciting the Tasbeeh:  Sami Allahu liman hamidah (Allah listens to him who has praised Him). 

After Tasbeeh recite Tahmeed: Allhumma Rabbana Lakal Hamd (O our Sustainer! All prayer is due to You alone)
title: Qawmah

text1:
Then say “Allahu Akbar” and go into Sajdah. 

In Sajdah recite 3 times: Subhaana Rabbiyal a’ala (Glory to my Lord Most High)
text2: First, the knees should touch the ground, thereafter the hands should be placed in line with the ears and the fingers should be close together. Then place the head in between both hands. Both the forehead and the nose should touch the ground. The fingers and toes should face the qibla but the feet should not be upright (Women are not required to place both feet standing on toes). They should be taken out towards the right side. The woman should draw herself closely together and press herself firmly while in Sajdah. The stomach should be joined to both thighs, the arms should be joined to the sides and both arms should be placed on the ground.
title: Sajdah

text1: Afterwards, go into a sitting position (Jalsa) while saying “Allahu Akbar”.
text2: The woman should sit on her left buttock and take out both her feet towards the right side. Both her hands should be on the thighs and her fingers joined together.
title: Jalsa (Sitting)

text1: Say “Allahu Akbar” and Do the Sajdah again. In Sajdah recite “Subhaana Rabbiyal a’ala” 3 times.
title: Sajdah

text1: Do the Qiyam for 2nd rakah. Recite Surah Fatiha:
text2: After Fatiha, recite any small surah or verses from the Qur’an. For example:
title: Qiyam (2nd Rakah)

text1: Say “Allahu Akbar” and go into Ruku (bowing). In Ruku recite the following 3 times: Subhaana Rabbiyal ‘Azeem (Glory be to my Lord, The Greatest)
title: Ruku (Bowing)

text1: Afterwards, stand up in Qawmah position while reciting:  Sami Allahu liman hamidah, then recite: Allhumma Rabbana Lakal Hamd
title: Qawmah

text1: Then say “Allahu Akbar” and go into Sajdah. In Sajdah recite 3 times: Subhaana Rabbiyal a’ala
title: Sajdah

text1: Afterwards, go into Jalsa while saying “Allahu Akbar”.
title: Jalsa

text1: Say “Allahu Akbar” and Do the Sajdah again. In Sajdah recite “Subhaana Rabbiyal a’ala” 3 times.
title: Sajdah

text1: After the second Sajdah, go into Jalsah while saying “Allahu Akbar”. While seated recite Tashahhud:
title: Jalsa (Tashahhud)

text1: Do the Qiyam for 3rd rakah. Recite Surah Fatiha:
text2: After Fatiha, recite any small surah or verses from the Qur’an. For example:
title: Qiyam (3rd Rakah)

text1: Raise hands to the ears with palms facing the Qibla and say “Allahu Akbar”
title: Takbir

text1: Do the Qiyam and recite dua Qunoot:
title: Qiyam

text1: Say “Allahu Akbar” and go into Ruku (bowing). In Ruku recite the following 3 times: Subhaana Rabbiyal ‘Azeem (Glory be to my Lord, The Greatest)
title: Ruku (Bowing)

text1: Afterwards, stand up in Qawmah position while reciting:  Sami Allahu liman hamidah, then recite: Allhumma Rabbana Lakal Hamd
title: Qawmah

text1: Then say “Allahu Akbar” and go into Sajdah. In Sajdah recite 3 times: Subhaana Rabbiyal a’ala

title: Jalsa

title: Sajdah

text1: After the second Sajdah, go into Jalsah while saying “Allahu Akbar”. While seated recite Tashahhud, Salawat and Dua:

text1: As the last step do Tasleem. Turn your head to the right and say  “As salamu ‘alaykum wa rahmatullah” (May the Peace and Mercy of Allah be upon you). Then turn your head to the left and say “As salamu ‘alaykum wa rahmatullah”
title: Tasleem (Salam)

text1: This completes three rak'ah Witr wajib prayer.
title: Finish

text1:
Make niyyah (intention) to perform wudu, and say "Bismillah" (in the name of Allah) before starting wudu.

Niyyah is the Islamic concept of performing an act for the sake of Allah. To truly perform wudu, you should center yourself and quiet your thoughts, focusing seriously on what you are doing (intending to perform wudu (ablution)).

Niyyah is not said out loud and should be made in the heart;
title: Niyyah (intention)

text1: Wash your hands three times. Make sure to wash in between your fingers and all the way up to your wrists.
title: Hands

text1: Take water into your mouth. Use your right hand to cup water into your mouth three times. Swish it around in your cheeks. Do this thoroughly.
title: Mouth

text1: Inhale water into your nose. Use your right hand to cup water and inhale it into your nose and blow out three times with left hand. Snort sharply and abruptly without taking too much water into your nose and choking yourself. If you cannot inhale water into your nose, you can wet your fingers and put water on the lower part of your nostrils.
title: Nose

text1: Wash your face. Wash your face three times by spreading your hands from your right ear to the left, and from the hairline to the chin.
title: Face

text1: Wash your lower arms from wrists to elbows, leaving no part dry. From your wrist to your elbow, wash your right arm with your left hand three times and then wash your left arm with your right hand three times.
title: Lower arms

text1: Clean your head. This is known as "maseh". Using your wet hands, gently wipe the entire head once, from the forehead to the back of the head, and wipe it again forward from the back of the head to the forehead.
title: Head

text1: Wipe your ears inside and out. Use your thumb to clean behind your ears from the bottom upward. This is also done one time.
title: Ears

text1: Wash both of your feet. Clean up to the ankles and be sure water goes between the toes. Use your pinky finger and go through each toe to eliminate anything between. Start with your right foot and scrub each foot three times.
title: Feet

text1:
The word Ghusl literally translates from Arabic to “wash” or “clean”. It is a full ablution or a ritual bath taken when in a state of major impurity to purify our bodies and ready ourselves to worship Allah.

Ghusl brings up a lot of questions, especially as newly weds when there is already an overwhelming amount of information to process along with the anxiousness to do things the right way. We’re here to answer some of the questions we’ve received in our inbox, verified by an aalimah.

Why Do We Perform Ghusl?

Allah says in the Qur’an:

  • “O Believers [faith]! If you are in a state of major impurity [that requires ritual bath], then purify yourselves.” (Qur’an 5:6)

Ghusl is considered an act of worship. One of the most important aspects of our faith is purification and cleanliness. The purpose of Ghusl is therefore to purify ourselves physically so that we are able to fulfil our spiritual duties. Ghusl is also mentioned in the Hadiths:

  • Aishah (RA) narrated that Asma (RA) asked the Prophet ﷺ about Ghusl following menses. He responded, “Let one of you take her water and lotus leaves and clean herself well, then let her pour water over her head and rub it vigorously so that it will reach the roots of her hair. Then let her pour the water over herself, then take a piece of cloth scented with musk and purify herself.” Asma (RA) said, “How should she purify herself?” He said, “SubhanAllah, purify yourself with it!” Aishah (RA) whispered to her to perfume the area where blood flowed. She then asked him about Ghusl in the case of post sexual impurity to which the Prophet ﷺ said, “Let her take water and clean herself well, then let her pour water over her head and rub it so that it reaches the roots of the hair, then let her pour water over herself.”
  • Aishah (RA) said, The best of women are the women of the Ansaar! They don’t let shyness prevent them from understanding their religion properly.” [Muslim]

When Should I Perform Ghusl?

Ghusl is Fard (obligatory) to perform in the following circumstances:

  • When in a state of Janabah (sexual impurity)
  • When menstruation and postpartum bleeding ends
  • When a wet dream has been seen and wetness is found, based on this hadith of Umm Salamah (RA) who reported that Umm Sulaim, the wife of Abu Talha, asked the Prophet ﷺ, “Allah is not shy when it comes to the truth. So is it obligatory for a woman to perform Ghusl if she has a wet dream (i.e. discharge comes out)? The Prophet ﷺ responded, “Yes, if she sees the fluid.” [Bukhari and Muslim]

* It is important to note here that most discharge in women is part of the natural cleansing of the vagina and does not indicate a wet dream. Also, if a wet dream is seen but no discharge is found, Ghusl is not necessary.

When is it Recommended to Perform Ghusl?

There are times when it is not obligatory to perform Ghusl, but instead recommended by the Sunnah:

  • When going out into a religious or social gathering including the prayers for rain and Eid
  • On Fridays
  • Before some acts of worship such as entering Ihram
  • For the deceased
  • After performing Ghusl for the deceased
  • When reverting to Islam

How to Perfom Ghusl

There are two types of Ghusl you can perform for different circumstances. The first is the obligatory form of Ghusl. This is performed when in a state of sexual impurity and involves less steps than the complete Ghusl:

Step 1: Start with the Niyyah or intention to purify yourself from the state of impurity in order to worship Allah

Step 2: Wash your entire body once making sure water reaches every part, including rinsing the mouth and nose

The second type of Ghusl is the complete Ghusl, and it is recommended to do this type of Ghusl after the bleeding of menstruation and postpartum has ended as evidenced by the following hadith:

  • Aishah (RA) said, “When the Prophet ﷺ did Ghusl for janabah, he would wash his hands and do wudu as for prayer, then he would wash himself, then he would run his fingers through his hair, then when he thought that it [the water] had reached his skin, he would pour water over it [the head] three times, then he would wash the rest of his body.” [Bukhari and Muslim]

Step 1: Start with the niyyah or intention to purify yourself from the state of impurity in order to worship Allah

Step 2: Say Bismillah

Step 3: Wash the hands three times

Step 4: Wash the private parts

Step 5: Do wudu

Step 6: Pour water over the head so that it reaches the roots

Step 7: Wash the whole body three times, starting from the right side then moving on to the left side

 

FAQs about Ghusl:

  • Should I unbraid my hair?

It is not a requirement for purification after sexual impurity but some scholars recommend it for purification after menstruation and postpartum bleeding.

Umm Salamah (RA) asked the Prophet ﷺ about that. She said, “I am a woman with braided hair; should I undo it when doing Ghusl for janabah?” He said, “No, rather it will be sufficient for you to pour three handfuls of water on your head, then pour water over yourself and you will be purified.”

  • Can I do Ghusl with my husband?

Yes, based on this hadith of Aisha (RA):

Aisha (RA) said, “The Prophet ﷺ and I used to perform Ghusl from the same container. He would sometimes get to it before me, so I would tell him, ‘Leave me some! Leave me some!’” [Bukhari and Muslim]

  • Do I have to do wudu after Ghusl? 

The scholars have confirmed that ghusl is purification and does not require an extra wudu.

  • Can I say Bismillah during Ghusl if I am in a bathroom? 

Scholars recommend that it is not said out loud, rather in the heart.

  • What if I continue to bleed past 40 days postpartum? 

40 days is the maximum time period. Before this, if bleeding stops, women are required to perform ghusl and continue their prayers. If the bleeding goes past 39 days, then ghusl must be performed at the end of the 40 days.

Tips for Ghusl

Ghusl often gets difficult for newly weds who live in joint households. It may feel difficult to perform Ghusl at odd hours, but it is important to remember you are only fulfilling Allah’s commands and there is nothing to be embarrassed about.
There may be slight differences in how ghusl is performed in different madhabs.
While doing ghusl, be conscious of getting water in places that are usually missed for example under piercings, the belly button, armpits, etc.
title: Ghusl

text1:
The word Tayammum is an Arabic word that means “aiming.” Tayammum in Islam aims to purify one’s hands and face with soil to prepare for prayers. This might raise several questions for those who are entirely unaware of the teachings of the Qur’an and Sunnah regarding Tayammum.

In Surah An Nisa 4:43 Qur’an says:

  • …And if you are ill or on a journey or one of you comes from the place of relieving himself or you have contacted women [i.e., had sexual intercourse] and find no water, then look for clean earth and wipe over your faces and your hands [with it]. Indeed, Allah is most Merciful and Forgiving.”

The leniency of Allah almighty through such verses makes it clear that religion is not a tool for oppression and limitation. The teachings regarding Tayammum are not only given in Qur’an but our Prophet (ﷺ) showed Tayammum with his actions and advised other Muslims to do Tayammum given certain situations.

  • "Perform Tayammum with clean earth and that will be sufficient for you." (Sahih Bukhari: 348)

How to do Tayammum?

Just like the directions for wudu or ghusl (bathing), Islam has given teachings about the ways Tayammum can be done. To do Tayammum, one can follow a step-by-step procedure given below:

  • Strike both hands on the ground. Anything that you feel clingy on your hands should be shaken off.
  • Use both your hands to wipe your face while following the movements done during the wudu.
  • Don’t forget to wipe the cartilage of the upper ears.
  • Strike your hands to the ground a second time.
  • Wipe your left hand and arm with your right hand and vice-versa.
  • Wipe the inner side of the left hand with the right hand and the inner side of the left hand with the right hand.

In Islam, it is also believed that this kind of purification is a blessing from God. If you are at some place where it's prayer time and do not have water in your vicinity, then you can always opt for tayammum.

Tayammum can replace obligatory wudu or bathing under specific circumstances, which are discussed below:

1. Absence or Lack of Sufficient Water

The foremost reason for Tayammum is the absence of water or the water you have is insufficient for purification. For prayers and other practices in Islam, such as touching or reciting Quran, it is essential to purify yourself.

These practices are considered holy and should be done with complete hygiene. Tayammum is advised when it is time to pray and you do not have access to water. In such conditions, Qur’an and Sunnah have allowed performing Tayammum.

Also, if you are sure that you will not be able to access water till the time of prayers, then you can perform Tayammum for prayers.

2. During Journey

Travelling is part of our everyday life. In such a situation, one can get clean with the act of Tayammum. If someone cannot find water before prayer, he/she is allowed to do Tayammum.

The absence of water during the journey is also a condition for this ablution. Otherwise, in case there is the availability of water and one can perform wudu, then Tayammum is not advised.

3. Injury or Bad Health Condition

Illness or injury can be a reason for Tayammum. Individuals with poor health conditions are given much lenient ways for prayers. For purification before prayers, an ill or incapable individual can do Tayammum.

If one has a condition that exposure to water can compromise his/her health, then in such case, this way of purification is allowed.

4. Harmful Water

Given such a situation where there is the availability of water but can harm, then Islam allows you to do Tayammum. For example, if the water is cold enough to harm you and cannot be heated, then in this case, you can purify yourself through this procedure.

In Qur’an, Allah says:

  • "…Do not kill yourselves [or one another]. Indeed, Allah is to you ever Merciful." (Surah An-Nisa 4:29)

5. Saving Water

Islam understands and provides ways of convenience according to the needs of a human being. In this regard, one can perform Tayammum if the water is too little and only enough to use for survival, like cooking, making dough, or purifying something forgivable.

During the times of Muhammad (ﷺ), many companions would save their drinking water during journeys and do Tayammum for prayers.

6. Avoiding Danger

If reaching water and fetching it brings danger to the life of the one who wishes to purify himself/herself, then Tayammum is the answer. Such kind of situation can be faced by travelers. During journeys, it is not safe to leave your possessions to fetch water for wudu, which is why Islam advises purifying through Tayammum and protecting your property.

7. Uncertainty of Reaching Water

This condition for Tayammum is related to performing the prayers on time. If one is still deciding whether to get access to water for wudu on time, then he/she should go for Tayammum. This way, you will be able to perform your prayers on time.

On the other hand, if someone is confident that he/she will find access to water, then Tayammum can be avoided until the last minute. In this case, Tayammum can be delayed in getting access to water for either wudu or ghusl (Bathing).


Bottom Line

In case one is entirely sure about the unavailability of water, then it is recommended that he/she should do Tayammum at the beginning of time. Making oneself clean for obligatory practices such as prayers and recitation of the Qur’an is crucial.

The concept of Tayammum in Islam gives extensive knowledge about the importance of purification in Islam. Given certain conditions, Tayammum in Islam gives us a possible way of purification to practice our religion.

 

Written by Dur-e-Sabih
title: Tayammum

text1:
The word Wudu is an Arabic word that means “ablution.”  Wudu is the Islamic procedure for cleansing parts of the body, a type of ritual purification, or ablution. The four Fardh (Mandatory) acts of wudu are washing the face, then the arms, then wiping the head, then washing or wiping the feet, and doing these in order without any big breaks between them.

Wudu is an important part of ritual purity in Islam. It is governed by fiqh (Islamic jurisprudence), which specifies hygienical jurisprudence and defines the rituals that constitute it. Ritual purity is called tahara.

Wudu is typically performed before salah (daily ritual prayer). Activities that invalidate wudu include urination, defecation, flatulence, deep sleep, light bleeding (depending on madhhab), menstruation, postpartum status, and sexual intercourse.

Wudu is often translated as 'partial ablution', as opposed to ghusl 'full ablution' where the whole body is washed. It also contrasts with tayammum or "dry ablution", which uses sand or dust in place of water principally due to water scarcity or other harmful effects on the person.
title: About wudu

text1:
Salat (Salah, Namaz) or Prayer is the most important pillar of Islam; Allah Almighty will question it on the Day of Resurrection. Performing Prayer is obligatory for every adult Muslim. Salah is a ritual prayer having prescribed conditions, and one must perform Salaah while fulfilling those conditions. We often perform Prayers or Salah as a practice or as a part of habit but tend to forget the fundamental essence of Namaz and make many mistakes during Prayer. 

Ten common mistakes and errors in Prayers or Salah are as follows:

1. Delaying the Salah intentionally

While busy in worldly affairs, we often delay the Salah from its preferred time. Deferring Salah is the most common mistake in Prayer made by most of us. We think that Praying is the last thing to do, and we must attend to other matters first. Many workers delay Zuhr and Asr Prayer till night-time. AlQuran speaks strictly on guarding our Salat:

“Guard strictly (five obligatory) As-Salawat (the prayers) especially the middle Salat (i.e., Asr Prayers)” [2:238]

Here, safeguarding the Salat means performing it at its prescribed time and steadfastly upon it. Narrated Ibn Umar (R.A): Allah’s Messenger (P.B.U.H) said:

“Whoever misses the Asr prayers (intentionally), then it is as if he lost his family and property.” [Al-Bukhari]

Another Hadith explains the importance of praying on time. Narrated Abu Al-Malih (R.A):

“We were with Buraidah in a battle on a cloudy day, and he said, “Offer the Asr prayer early as the Prophet (P.B.U.H) said, “Whoever omits the Asr prayer, all his (good) deeds will be lost.” [Al-Bukhari]

2. Reciting Holy Quran fast in the Prayers

We must pause and take breaks while reciting the Holy Quran during Salat. We should not recite the Surah so fast that the verse gets intermingled. One of the Hadith emphasizes this issue:

“The Prophet (P.B.U.H) used to pause after each verse of Surah al-Fatiha. [Abu Dawood]

3. Mistake in moving before the Imam in congregational prayers

One should not race with the Imam, i.e., try to move before the Imam or with the Imam, because the correct ruling is when Imam says Allahu Akbar. The person following the Imam in Prayers should say, Allahu Akbar. Not before Imam or with Imam. This Hadith of the Prophet (P.B.U.H) states:

“Surely the imam is there to be followed” [Muslim]

Another Hadith states:

The Prophet (P.B.U.H) said:

“Does not the one who raises his head before the Imam does fear that Allah would transform his head into a donkey’s head” [Muslim]

4. Performing the Salah hastily

One should perform Salat slowly and calmly. One should perform Rukoo or Sujood calmly. To complete the Rukoo, one must stay in Rukoo posture long enough to recite “Subhan Rabbi you Adtheem” at least three times. Similarly, the person should say “Subhan-a Rabbi yal-ala” three times slowly for the Sujood. This Hadith commands to complete the Rukoo and Sujood correctly:

The Messenger of Allah (P.B.U.H) said:

“The worst thief is the one who steals from his prayer.” People asked: ‘Messenger of Allah! How could one steal from his Prayer?’ He said: “By not completing its rukoo and sujood” [at-Tabarani]

The Prophet (P.B.U.H) said:

“He who does not complete his rukoo and sujood, his prayer is void” [Abu Dawood]

5. Gazing right, left, or upward during Salat

While performing Salah, one should concentrate on looking to the point where the head is placed during Sujood rather than looking upwards because this may lose concentration. In the Hadith recorded by Sahih Muslim, the Prophet (P.B.U.H) said:

“Let those who raise their gaze during prayer stop doing so, or else their sights would not return to them” (i.e., they will lose their eyesight) [Muslim]

6. Performing Sujood improperly

The most common mistake observed in Prayers is to perform Sujood by resting only the tip of the head on the floor.

The Prophet (P.B.U.H) said:

“I am commanded to prostrate on seven bones the forehead and the nose, the two hands [palms], the two knees, and the two feet” [Muslim]

7. Not performing Prayers during illness or while traveling

The Prophet (P.B.U.H) always performed Prayer even during His last days before death. He (P.B.U.H) never neglected it, even during combats. Prayer is obligatory and must be performed in any condition. If a person cannot perform ablution due to his illness, he may perform tayammum (dry ablution). He may perform Salah while sitting or even lying down if he cannot stand in Prayer. The same is the case while traveling. The person can combine 2 Salah while traveling, i.e., Zuhr Prayer and Asr Prayer. or Maghrib Prayer and Isha Prayer.

8. Crossing in front of a person who is performing Salah

The Prophet (P.B.U.H) said:

“Were the one who crosses in front of a praying person to know the consequences of doing so, he would have waited for forty better than to cross in front of him” [Bukhari]

9. Going to Mosque to perform Salah with a quick walk

When Prayer approaches, some person fears that he might miss his Salah; for this fear, most of us try to walk quickly or run for fear of missing some part of the Prayer; this is not allowed, according to Hadith. The Messenger of Allah (P.B.U.H) said:

“When prayer has already started, do not walk quickly to join in. Proceed calmly and reposefully; then join in whichever part you catch up, and complete whichever part you missed”. [Bukhari and Muslim]

10. Eating food with a foul smell before performing Prayers

Consuming foods with a terrible smell like garlic or onion should not be taken before the Salah because the bad breath may irritate the angels and the praying people. The Prophet (P.B.U.H) said:

“He who eats from the smelly plant [garlic or onion], let him come not near our mosque; the angels are bothered by that which bothers men” [Muslim]

May Allah guides us to perform our Salah perfectly and help us to guard our Salat so when on the Day of Judgment we are questioned about our prayers, we may succeed. Ameen.

 

source: alquranclasses.com
title: 10 Common Mistakes in Salah

text1:
Tahorat olish uchun, iloji bo'lsa, qiblaga yuzlaniladi. «A'uzu billahi minash-shaytonir rojiym. Bismillahir rohmanir rohiym, tahorat olmoqlikka niyat qildim», deb niyat qilinadi.

Eslatma: Tirnoqlarga surilgan lak, teridagi har xil bo'yoqlar ketkazilmasdan olingan tahorat sahih (haqiqiy) hisoblanmaydi.

Tahorat olayotganda gapirmaslik, ehtiyojdan ortiq suv ishlatmaslik, ust-boshga suv sachratmaslik kerak.
title: Niyat

text1: Qo'llar bandigacha uch marta yuviladi. Barmoqda uzuk bo'lsa, qimirlatib, ostiga suv yugurtiriladi. Barmoqlar bir birining orasiga kiritiladi.
title: Qo'llarni yuvish

text1: Tishlar misvok yoki tish yuvish pastasi bilan, yoki qo'l bilan ishqalab yuviladi. O'ng qo'lda suv olinib, og'iz uch marta g'arg'ara qilib chayiladi.
title: Og'iz chayish

text1: Burunga o'ng qo'l bilan uch marta suv tortilib, chap qo'l bilan qoqib tozalanadi.
title: Burunni chayish

text1:
Yuz uch marta yuviladi. Yuzning chegarasi
uzunasiga soch chiqqan joydan jag'ning ostigacha
kengligi esa ikki quloq yumshog'ining orasigacha bo'lgan o'rindir.
title: Yuzni yuvish

text1: Avval o'ng qo'l, keyin esa chap qo'l tirsak bilan qo'shib yuviladi.
title: Qo'llarni tirsakgacha yuvish

text1: Hovuchga suv olib, to'kib tashlab, - ho'li bilan boshning hamma qismiga bir marta mas'h tortiladi.
title: Boshga mas'h tortish

text1:
Ko'rsatkich barmoq bilan quloq ichiga mas'h tortib, bosh barmoq bilan esa quloq orqasi mas'h qilinadi.

Ikkala kaftning orqasi bilan bo'yin mas'h qilinadi.
title: Quloq va bo'yinga mas'h tortish

text1:
Chap qo'l bilan o'ng oyoqni oshiq(to'piq) bilan va barmoqlar orasini(ishqalab) uch marta yuviladi.

Chap oyoq ham shu tarzda uch marta yuviladi.
title: Oyoqlarni yuvish

text1:
Islom dini ham vujud, ham qalb tozaligiga katta ahamiyat bergan bir dindir. Sevikli payg'ambarimiz sallallohu alayhi vasallam bizga shunday nasihat qiladilar: «Kuchingiz yetguncha tozalikka rioya etingiz, chunki Alloh taolo Islom dinini tozalik ustiga bino qildi. Jannatga ham faqat toza bo'lganlar kiradi» («Jomius-sag'ir», 1-jild, 133-bet).

Alloh taolo Qur'oni karimning Moida surasi 6-oyatida shunday marhamat qiladi (mazmuni): «Ey imon keltirganlar! Namoz (o'qish) ga turar ekansiz, albatta, yuzlaringizni, qo'llaringizni tirsaklarigacha yuvingizlar, boshlaringizga mas'h tortingizlar va oyoqlaringizni (yuvingizlar)!».

Binobarin, dinimizning ustuni hisoblangan namozni ado etmoq uchun albatta tahoratli bo'lish shartdir.
title: Tahorat nima?

text1:
1. Badanning biror joyidan qon yoxud yiring chiqib oqishi.
  2. Og'iz to'lib qusish.
  3. Kichik yo katta hojat.
  4. Yel chiqishi.
  5. Milk qonab, tupurganda tupuk rangining qizil bo'lishi.
  6. Hushdan ketish.
  7. Namoz o'qiyotib, yonidagi odam eshitadigan darajada kulish.
title: Tahoratni buzadigan hollar

text1:
Uyquda ehtilom bo'lib qolinganida, jinsiy aloqadan keyin hamda ayollar hayz va nifos holatidan chiqishgach, g'usl (butun badanni suv bilan ishqalab yuvish) farzdir.

Bundan tashqari, har juma va hayit namozlari oldidan g'usl qilish sunnat – Payg'ambarimiz sollallohu alayhi va sallam bajargan amallardandir.

G'uslning farzlari:

  1. Og'izga suv olib g'arg'ara qilish.
  2. Burunga achishtirguncha suv tortish.
  3. Butun badanni tozalab yuvish.

G'usl quyidagi tartibda qilinadi:

  1. «Bismillahir rohmanir rohiym» deyiladi va g'uslga niyat qilinadi:

«Navaytu an agʼtasila gʼuslan minal janabati raf'an lil hadasi va istibahatan lis-solati taqorruban minallohi ta'ala».

Ma'nosi: Nopoklikni ketkazish, namoz o'qishni joiz etish hamda Allohga yaqinlik istab g'uslni niyat qildim.

  1. Qo'llar yuvilgach, badan maniy yoxud boshqa nopok narsalardan tozalanadi.
  2. Belgilangan tartibda tahorat olinadi. Avval boshga, keyin o'ng va chap yelkaga suv quyilib, butun badan yaxshilab yuviladi. Bu yuvinishda badanda ignaning uchiday quruq joy qolsa ham, g'usl mukammal olinmagan hisoblanadi.

G'uslga ehtiyojmand kishi og'zi va burnini chayib, so'ng cho'milsa ham, g'usl olgan hisobiga o'tadi.
title: G'usl

text1:
Alloh taolo Niso surasining 43-oyatida shunday marhamat qiladi (mazmuni): «Bordiyu betob yo safarda bo'lsangizlar yoki sizlardan birortangiz hojatxonadan chiqqan bo'lsa yoxud xotinlaringiz bilan yaqinlik qilgan bo'lsangiz-u suv topa olmasangiz, pokiza yer (tuproq, tosh, qum, chang kabilar) bilan tayammum qilib, yuzlaringiz va qo'llaringizga surting. Albatta, Alloh avf etuvchi va kechiruvchidir».

Tayammum qilishda tahoratga yoki g'uslga ham niyat qilinadi. Har ikkisini qo'shib niyat qilish ham mumkin.

Tayammum olish tartibi quyidagichadir:

  1. Yenglarni tirsaklarigacha shimarib «Tahorat (yoki g'usl) uchun tayammum olishga niyat qildim», deb ko'ngildan o'tkaziladi.
  2. «A'uzu billahi minash-shaytonir rojiym. Bismillahir rohmanir rohiym», deyiladi va qo'llar, barmoqlari ochiq holda, tuproq yoki tuproq jinsidan bo'lgan biror narsaga bir marta uriladi.
  3. Qo'llarning ichi (kaft) bilan yuzga mas'h tortiladi.
  4. Qo'llarni ikkinchi bor tuproq yoki tuproq jinsidan bo'lgan narsaga urib, chap qo'lning kafti bilan o'ng qo'lga tirsagi bilan qo'shib, o'ng qo'l kafti bilan esa chap qo'lga ayni tarzda mas'h etiladi.

Tayammumni buzadigan hollar:

  1. Tahoratga yaroqli suv topishi.
  2. Badandagi yara yoki (boshqa) uzr tufayli tayammum olgan kishidan bu holatlarning ketishi.
  3. Tahoratni buzadigan hollar tayammumni ham buzadi.
title: Tayammum

text1:
Таҳорат олиш учун, иложи бўлса, қиблага юзланилади. «Aъузу биллаҳи минаш-шайтонир рожийм. Бисмиллаҳир роҳманир роҳийм, таҳорат олмоқликка ният қилдим», деб ният қилинади.

Еслатма: Тирноқларга сурилган лак, теридаги ҳар хил бўёқлар кетказилмасдан олинган таҳорат саҳиҳ (ҳақиқий) ҳисобланмайди.

Таҳорат олаётганда гапирмаслик, эҳтиёждан ортиқ сув ишлатмаслик, уст-бошга сув сачратмаслик керак.
title: Ният

text1: Қўллар бандигача уч марта ювилади. Бармоқда узук бўлса, қимирлатиб, остига сув югуртирилади. Бармоқлар бир бирининг орасига киритилади.
title: Қўлларни ювиш

text1: Тишлар мисвок ёки тиш ювиш пастаси билан, ёки қўл билан ишқалаб ювилади. Ўнг қўлда сув олиниб, оғиз уч марта ғарғара қилиб чайилади.
title: Оғиз чайиш

text1: Бурунга ўнг қўл билан уч марта сув тортилиб, чап қўл билан қоқиб тозаланади.
title: Бурунни чайиш

text1:
Юз уч марта ювилади. Юзнинг чегараси
узунасига соч чиққан жойдан жағнинг остигача
кенглиги эса икки қулоқ юмшоғининг орасигача бўлган ўриндир.
title: Юзни ювиш

text1: Aввал ўнг қўл, кейин эса чап қўл тирсак билан қўшиб ювилади.
title: Қўлларни тирсакгача ювиш

text1: Ҳовучга сув олиб, тўкиб ташлаб, - ҳўли билан бошнинг ҳамма қисмига бир марта масъҳ тортилади.
title: Бошга масъҳ тортиш

text1:
Кўрсаткич бармоқ билан қулоқ ичига масъҳ тортиб, бош бармоқ билан эса қулоқ орқаси масъҳ қилинади.

Иккала кафтнинг орқаси билан бўйин масъҳ қилинади.
title: Қулоқ ва бўйинга масъҳ тортиш

text1:
Чап қўл билан ўнг оёқни ошиқ(тўпиқ) билан ва бармоқлар орасини(ишқалаб) уч марта ювилади.

Чап оёқ ҳам шу тарзда уч марта ювилади.
title: Оёқларни ювиш

text1:
Ислом дини ҳам вужуд, ҳам қалб тозалигига катта аҳамият берган бир диндир. Севикли пайғамбаримиз саллаллоҳу алайҳи васаллам бизга шундай насиҳат қиладилар: «Кучингиз етгунча тозаликка риоя этингиз, чунки Aллоҳ таоло Ислом динини тозалик устига бино қилди. Жаннатга ҳам фақат тоза бўлганлар киради» («Жомиус-сағир», 1-жилд, 133-бет).

Aллоҳ таоло Қуръони каримнинг Моида сураси 6-оятида шундай марҳамат қилади (мазмуни): «Ей имон келтирганлар! Намоз (ўқиш) га турар экансиз, албатта, юзларингизни, қўлларингизни тирсакларигача ювингизлар, бошларингизга масъҳ тортингизлар ва оёқларингизни (ювингизлар)!».

Бинобарин, динимизнинг устуни ҳисобланган намозни адо этмоқ учун албатта таҳоратли бўлиш шартдир.
title: Таҳорат нима?

text1:
1. Баданнинг бирор жойидан қон ёхуд йиринг чиқиб оқиши.
  2. Оғиз тўлиб қусиш.
  3. Кичик ё катта ҳожат.
  4. Йел чиқиши.
  5. Милк қонаб, тупурганда тупук рангининг қизил бўлиши.
  6. Ҳушдан кетиш.
  7. Намоз ўқиётиб, ёнидаги одам эшитадиган даражада кулиш.
title: Таҳоратни бузадиган ҳоллар

text1:
Уйқуда эҳтилом бўлиб қолинганида, жинсий алоқадан кейин ҳамда аёллар ҳайз ва нифос ҳолатидан чиқишгач, ғусл (бутун баданни сув билан ишқалаб ювиш) фарздир.

Бундан ташқари, ҳар жума ва ҳайит намозлари олдидан ғусл қилиш суннат – Пайғамбаримиз соллаллоҳу алайҳи ва саллам бажарган амаллардандир.

Ғуслнинг фарзлари:

  1. Оғизга сув олиб ғарғара қилиш.
  2. Бурунга ачиштиргунча сув тортиш.
  3. Бутун баданни тозалаб ювиш.

Ғусл қуйидаги тартибда қилинади:

  1. «Бисмиллаҳир роҳманир роҳийм» дейилади ва ғуслга ният қилинади:

«Навайту ан ағтасила ғуслан минал жанабати рафъан лил ҳадаси ва истибаҳатан лис-солати тақоррубан миналлоҳи таъала».

Маъноси: Нопокликни кетказиш, намоз ўқишни жоиз этиш ҳамда Aллоҳга яқинлик истаб ғуслни ният қилдим.

  1. Қўллар ювилгач, бадан маний ёхуд бошқа нопок нарсалардан тозаланади.
  2. Белгиланган тартибда таҳорат олинади. Aввал бошга, кейин ўнг ва чап елкага сув қуйилиб, бутун бадан яхшилаб ювилади. Бу ювинишда баданда игнанинг учидай қуруқ жой қолса ҳам, ғусл мукаммал олинмаган ҳисобланади.

Ғуслга эҳтиёжманд киши оғзи ва бурнини чайиб, сўнг чўмилса ҳам, ғусл олган ҳисобига ўтади.
title: Ғусл

text1:
Aллоҳ таоло Нисо сурасининг 43-оятида шундай марҳамат қилади (мазмуни): «Бордию бетоб ё сафарда бўлсангизлар ёки сизлардан бирортангиз ҳожатхонадан чиққан бўлса ёхуд хотинларингиз билан яқинлик қилган бўлсангиз-у сув топа олмасангиз, покиза ер (тупроқ, тош, қум, чанг кабилар) билан таяммум қилиб, юзларингиз ва қўлларингизга суртинг. Aлбатта, Aллоҳ авф этувчи ва кечирувчидир».

Таяммум қилишда таҳоратга ёки ғуслга ҳам ният қилинади. Ҳар иккисини қўшиб ният қилиш ҳам мумкин.

Таяммум олиш тартиби қуйидагичадир:

  1. Йенгларни тирсакларигача шимариб «Таҳорат (ёки ғусл) учун таяммум олишга ният қилдим», деб кўнгилдан ўтказилади.
  2. «Aъузу биллаҳи минаш-шайтонир рожийм. Бисмиллаҳир роҳманир роҳийм», дейилади ва қўллар, бармоқлари очиқ ҳолда, тупроқ ёки тупроқ жинсидан бўлган бирор нарсага бир марта урилади.
  3. Қўлларнинг ичи (кафт) билан юзга масъҳ тортилади.
  4. Қўлларни иккинчи бор тупроқ ёки тупроқ жинсидан бўлган нарсага уриб, чап қўлнинг кафти билан ўнг қўлга тирсаги билан қўшиб, ўнг қўл кафти билан эса чап қўлга айни тарзда масъҳ этилади.

Таяммумни бузадиган ҳоллар:

  1. Таҳоратга яроқли сув топиши.
  2. Бадандаги яра ёки (бошқа) узр туфайли таяммум олган кишидан бу ҳолатларнинг кетиши.
  3. Таҳоратни бузадиган ҳоллар таяммумни ҳам бузади.
title: Таяммум

text1: Прежде чем приступить к ритуальному омовению, желательно выразить намерение. Мысленно намерение можно выразить следующим образом: «А'узу билляхи минаш-шайтанир-раджим, бисмилляхи-р-Рахмани-р-Рахим, Я намереваюсь совершить малое омовение», — и приступить к требуемым действиям
title: Ният (намерение)

text1: Кисти. Омовение начинается с кистей рук. Сунна — омыть каждую кисть не более и не менее трех раз. Начинать омовение следует с правой руки.
title: Омовение рук

text1: Рот. Следующее действие полоскание ротовой полости (мадмада). Совершить это следует трижды. При набирании воды в рот используется правая рука.
title: Полоскание рта

text1: Нос. Вслед за ротовой полостью промывается нос (истиншак). Для этого необходимо набрать воду в правую руку и вобрать в себя воду носом, после чего с помощью левой руки высморкать воду обратно. Совершить это следует трижды.
title: Полоскание носа

text1:
Лицо. Область омытия лица — от верхней части лба до края подбородка по вертикали и от мочки одного уха до мочки другого по горизонтали.

Борода. Если борода густая, то достаточно промыть ее внешнюю часть в границах лица. Если борода жидкая (такая, что при обычном взгляде на лицо видна кожа под волосами бороды), то необходимо промывать как внешнюю, таки внутреннюю сторону бороды в границах лица, а также кожу под ней.
title: Мытье лица

text1: <b>Руки.<b> Следующее действие — мытье рук. Руки умываются по локти включительно. Для этого желательно омыть руки выше локтей, чтобы быть уверенным в выполнении данного требования. Омовение совершается трижды и начинается с правой руки.
title: Мытье рук до локтей

text1: Голова. Протирание (масх) головы. Вслед за омовением рук протирают голову один раз.
title: Протирание головы

text1: Уши. Промыть уши большим и указательным пальцем: уши должны быть вымыты как внутри, так и за ушной раковиной.
title: Протирание ушей

text1:
Ступни. Заключительное действие омовение ступней. Ступни омываются трижды, включая щиколотки. Омовение начинается сначала с правой ступни, а затем левую ступню. используется левая рука.

Желательно протирать (тахлиль) между пальцами ног. Если человек подставит ногу под кран с водой, это заменит протирание между пальцами.
title: Мытье ног

text1:
Особая роль в исламской религии отводится ритуалу омовения или тахарату, и целый ряд обрядов поклонения мусульмане не могут совершать без омовения. Оно является обязательным условием для намаза, как сказал Пророк Мухаммад ﷺ: Ключ к раю - намаз, а ключ к намазу - омовение. Без правильного омовения молитва мусульманина будет недействительна.

Под термином «тахарат» понимают очищение человека не только от внешней нечистоты, но и от внутренней, не только от физической, но и от духовной. Тахарат подразделяют на внутренний и внешний. Внутренний тахарат достигается праведностью и покаянием, а внешний достигается путем полного или малого омовения.

Термин «омовение» означает ритуальное очищение, которое верующим желательно и даже обязательно совершать в течение дня неоднократно.
title: Что такое омовение?

text1:
После того, как верующий совершил малое омовение, он находится в состоянии ритуальной чистоты, и в этом состоянии он может совершить намаз или молитву, приступать к чтению Священной Книги Коран. Состояние ритуальной чистоты сохраняется у верующего до тех пор, пока он не совершит что-либо, что нарушит это состояние.

К действиям и поступкам, которые нарушают состояние ритуальной чистоты после совершения малого омовения, относятся:

  1. если мусульманин справил нужду и/или произошел выход газов из кишечника;
  2. если мусульманин потерял сознание;
  3. сон лежа (дремать в положении стоя или сидя не относится к таким случаям, если человек находится в сознании);
  4. если у человека из тела происходили в больших количествах другие выделения типа гноя или крови;
  5. если в этот период человек прикасался к своим половым органом, но прикосновения к половым органам через ткань к такой ситуации не относятся;
  6. если у мусульманина в обозначенный период открывалась настолько сильная рвота, что рвотными массами была заполнена вся ротовая полость.
title: Когда нужно брать омовение?

text1:
Омовение тела, всех его частей, которое мусульманин должен выполнить тогда, когда он пребывает в состоянии ритуального осквернения. Как сказано в Священной Книге Коран, «Если вы осквернены, то искупайтесь» (5:6).

Существуют ситуации, когда малого омовения недостаточно, и мусульманину требуется совершить гусль или полное омовение. К таким ситуациям относятся:

  1. ситуация после того, как мусульманин вступил в интимную близость, даже если она заключалась только в соприкосновении половыми органами и не было семяизвержения;
  2. ситуация, когда семяизвержение произошло, но оно случилось не потому, что имела место интимная близость, а стало следствием того, что у мусульманина были страстные мысли, приведшие к возбуждению, либо он смотрел изображения, являющиеся запретными, на которых изображены обнаженные тела, а также если семяизвержение стало результатом поллюций;
  3. ситуация, когда женщина находится в постменструальном периоде, поскольку в период самой менструации женщинам запрещено соблюдать пост, молиться, совершать намазы, в этот период она находится в состоянии ритуального осквернения, и ей следует совершить гусль после того, как завершится менструация;
  4. ситуация, когда женщина находится в послеродовом периоде, поскольку в этот период у нее продолжаются послеродовые кровотечения, и по их завершении женщине следует совершить гусль;
  5. ситуация, когда человек только принял ислам, и ему следует произвести полное омовение после произнесения шахады;
  6. в случае смерти мусульманина – омовение тела покойного следует совершить полное.

Что запрещено делать без гусля?

Без совершения полного омовения, когда мусульманин находится в состоянии ритуального осквернения, ему запрещено делать некоторые вещи:

  • мусульманину запрещено прикасаться к Священной Книге Коран, текст которой полностью написан на арабском языке, допускается прикасаться к переводам на другие языки;
  • совершать намаз;
  • посещать мечеть;
  • совершать ритуальный обход вокруг Священной Каабы.

Правильный порядок омовения гусль

Как брать омовение гусль? Полное омовение совершается по следующим правилам и в следующей последовательности:

  1. проговаривается мысленно намерение для совершения полного омовения или гусля точно так же, как это следует делать перед выполнением вуду;
  2. прочитать вслух слова «Бисмилляхир-Рахманир-Рахиим»;
  3. начинают омовение с того, что омывают кисти рук до области запястий трижды, и уделяют внимание участкам кожи между пальцами рук, и это омывание рук следует начинать с правой руки;
  4. продолжают омывание, уделяя внимание половым органам, и протирать их следует с особой тщательностью, чтобы все нечистоты были устранены, вымыть их следует с помощью не правой руки, а левой руки;
  5. далее следует совершить все те действия, которые совершают при малом омовении: повторить процедуру мытья ладоней рук, но протирать ступни следует в самом конце;
  6. далее совершается омывание головы: следует облить голову водой три раза, чтобы были смочены все волосы, а также чтобы были смочены усы и борода, не осталось сухих волос от корней до кончиков;
  7. далее следует произвести омывание тела, вымыть его правую сторону, для этого следует использовать достаточно воды, чтобы омыть правую сторону три раза, но не следует излишне расходовать воду;
  8. далее следует произвести троекратное омывание левой части тела;
  9. последним этапом следует произвести омывание ног, тщательно промыв участки кожи между пальцами.
title: Гусль (полное омовение)

text1:
Таяммум – это ритуальное очищение без использования воды. Он заменяет вуду или гусуль в определенных случаях. Таяммум является даром Аллаха Пророку Мухаммаду (саллаллаху алейхи ва саллям) и нам, Его последователям для того, чтобы облегчить ибаду.

Фарды таяммума.

1. Намерение.
2. Два раза ударить ладонями по чистому песку, земле (или пыли, если нет пеcка, земли) и протереть после первого удара лицо, а после второго удара руки, включая локти.

Сунны таяммума.

1. Произнести «Бисмиллях»
2. Соблюдение последовательности.
3. Совершение таяммум без длительных пауз
4. Во время удара повести руку по песку, земле или, пыли вперед, затем назад.
5. Во время удара о песок не держать пальцы сомкнутыми.
6. Стряхивать после удара остатки песка, земли или пыли, ударяя руки друг о друга.
7. Делать таяммум после наступления времени намаза.

Как совершается таяммум

1. Сначала закатываются рукава до локтей. Если на руках имеются часы или кольца, их необходимо снять или сдвинуть, чтобы можно было протереть места под ними. 
2. Делается намерение для совершения таяммума вместо вуду или гусуля.
3. Произносятся слова «Аузу…» и «Бисмиллях…».
4. Ладони в раскрытом виде ударяются о песок, землю или пыль. Если к ладоням прилипли песчинки или пыль, то следует стряхнуть их, ударив руки друг о друга.
5. Затем ладонями протирается лицо. 
6. Потом ладони ударяются второй раз о новый песок, землю или пыль (при необходимости остатки песка стряхиваются так же, как и после первого удара). 
7. Сначала левой ладонью протирается правая рука, включая локоть, затем правой ладонью протирается левая рука, включая локоть.

Обстоятельства, нарушающие таяммум.

1. Все, что нарушает омовение, нарушает и таяммум.
2. Обнаружении воды или возможности использовать воду.
3. Устранении причины, по которой человек делал таяммум (например, заживление раны).

В каких ситуациях совершается таяммум.

1. Если нет достаточного количества чистой воды в радиусе 2 км, чтобы совершить вуду или гусуль.
2. Если есть вода, но нет возможности ее использовать.
3. Если есть раны или болезнь, из-за которых нельзя использовать воду.
title: Таяммум

text1:
Make niyyah (intention) to perform wudu, and say "Bismillah" (in the name of Allah) before starting wudu.

Niyyah is the Islamic concept of performing an act for the sake of Allah. To truly perform wudu, you should center yourself and quiet your thoughts, focusing seriously on what you are doing (intending to perform wudu (ablution)).

Niyyah is not said out loud and should be made in the heart;
title: Niyyah (intention)

text1: Wash your hands three times. Make sure to wash in between your fingers and all the way up to your wrists.
title: Hands

text1: Take water into your mouth. Use your right hand to cup water into your mouth three times. Swish it around in your cheeks. Do this thoroughly.
title: Mouth

text1: Inhale water into your nose. Use your right hand to cup water and inhale it into your nose and blow out three times with left hand. Snort sharply and abruptly without taking too much water into your nose and choking yourself. If you cannot inhale water into your nose, you can wet your fingers and put water on the lower part of your nostrils.
title: Nose

text1: Wash your face. Wash your face three times by spreading your hands from your right ear to the left, and from the hairline to the chin.
title: Face

text1: Wash your lower arms from wrists to elbows, leaving no part dry. From your wrist to your elbow, wash your right arm with your left hand three times and then wash your left arm with your right hand three times.
title: Lower arms

text1: Clean your head. This is known as "maseh". Using your wet hands, gently wipe the entire head once, from the forehead to the back of the head, and wipe it again forward from the back of the head to the forehead.
title: Head

text1: Wipe your ears inside and out. Use your thumb to clean behind your ears from the bottom upward. This is also done one time.
title: Ears

text1: Wash both of your feet. Clean up to the ankles and be sure water goes between the toes. Use your pinky finger and go through each toe to eliminate anything between. Start with your right foot and scrub each foot three times.
title: Feet

text1:
The word Ghusl literally translates from Arabic to “wash” or “clean”. It is a full ablution or a ritual bath taken when in a state of major impurity to purify our bodies and ready ourselves to worship Allah.

Ghusl brings up a lot of questions, especially as newly weds when there is already an overwhelming amount of information to process along with the anxiousness to do things the right way. We’re here to answer some of the questions we’ve received in our inbox, verified by an aalimah.

Why Do We Perform Ghusl?

Allah says in the Qur’an:

  • “O Believers [faith]! If you are in a state of major impurity [that requires ritual bath], then purify yourselves.” (Qur’an 5:6)

Ghusl is considered an act of worship. One of the most important aspects of our faith is purification and cleanliness. The purpose of Ghusl is therefore to purify ourselves physically so that we are able to fulfil our spiritual duties. Ghusl is also mentioned in the Hadiths:

  • Aishah (RA) narrated that Asma (RA) asked the Prophet ﷺ about Ghusl following menses. He responded, “Let one of you take her water and lotus leaves and clean herself well, then let her pour water over her head and rub it vigorously so that it will reach the roots of her hair. Then let her pour the water over herself, then take a piece of cloth scented with musk and purify herself.” Asma (RA) said, “How should she purify herself?” He said, “SubhanAllah, purify yourself with it!” Aishah (RA) whispered to her to perfume the area where blood flowed. She then asked him about Ghusl in the case of post sexual impurity to which the Prophet ﷺ said, “Let her take water and clean herself well, then let her pour water over her head and rub it so that it reaches the roots of the hair, then let her pour water over herself.”
  • Aishah (RA) said, The best of women are the women of the Ansaar! They don’t let shyness prevent them from understanding their religion properly.” [Muslim]

When Should I Perform Ghusl?

Ghusl is Fard (obligatory) to perform in the following circumstances:

  • When in a state of Janabah (sexual impurity)
  • When menstruation and postpartum bleeding ends
  • When a wet dream has been seen and wetness is found, based on this hadith of Umm Salamah (RA) who reported that Umm Sulaim, the wife of Abu Talha, asked the Prophet ﷺ, “Allah is not shy when it comes to the truth. So is it obligatory for a woman to perform Ghusl if she has a wet dream (i.e. discharge comes out)? The Prophet ﷺ responded, “Yes, if she sees the fluid.” [Bukhari and Muslim]

* It is important to note here that most discharge in women is part of the natural cleansing of the vagina and does not indicate a wet dream. Also, if a wet dream is seen but no discharge is found, Ghusl is not necessary.

When is it Recommended to Perform Ghusl?

There are times when it is not obligatory to perform Ghusl, but instead recommended by the Sunnah:

  • When going out into a religious or social gathering including the prayers for rain and Eid
  • On Fridays
  • Before some acts of worship such as entering Ihram
  • For the deceased
  • After performing Ghusl for the deceased
  • When reverting to Islam

How to Perfom Ghusl

There are two types of Ghusl you can perform for different circumstances. The first is the obligatory form of Ghusl. This is performed when in a state of sexual impurity and involves less steps than the complete Ghusl:

Step 1: Start with the Niyyah or intention to purify yourself from the state of impurity in order to worship Allah

Step 2: Wash your entire body once making sure water reaches every part, including rinsing the mouth and nose

The second type of Ghusl is the complete Ghusl, and it is recommended to do this type of Ghusl after the bleeding of menstruation and postpartum has ended as evidenced by the following hadith:

  • Aishah (RA) said, “When the Prophet ﷺ did Ghusl for janabah, he would wash his hands and do wudu as for prayer, then he would wash himself, then he would run his fingers through his hair, then when he thought that it [the water] had reached his skin, he would pour water over it [the head] three times, then he would wash the rest of his body.” [Bukhari and Muslim]

Step 1: Start with the niyyah or intention to purify yourself from the state of impurity in order to worship Allah

Step 2: Say Bismillah

Step 3: Wash the hands three times

Step 4: Wash the private parts

Step 5: Do wudu

Step 6: Pour water over the head so that it reaches the roots

Step 7: Wash the whole body three times, starting from the right side then moving on to the left side

 

FAQs about Ghusl:

  • Should I unbraid my hair?

It is not a requirement for purification after sexual impurity but some scholars recommend it for purification after menstruation and postpartum bleeding.

Umm Salamah (RA) asked the Prophet ﷺ about that. She said, “I am a woman with braided hair; should I undo it when doing Ghusl for janabah?” He said, “No, rather it will be sufficient for you to pour three handfuls of water on your head, then pour water over yourself and you will be purified.”

  • Can I do Ghusl with my husband?

Yes, based on this hadith of Aisha (RA):

Aisha (RA) said, “The Prophet ﷺ and I used to perform Ghusl from the same container. He would sometimes get to it before me, so I would tell him, ‘Leave me some! Leave me some!’” [Bukhari and Muslim]

  • Do I have to do wudu after Ghusl? 

The scholars have confirmed that ghusl is purification and does not require an extra wudu.

  • Can I say Bismillah during Ghusl if I am in a bathroom? 

Scholars recommend that it is not said out loud, rather in the heart.

  • What if I continue to bleed past 40 days postpartum? 

40 days is the maximum time period. Before this, if bleeding stops, women are required to perform ghusl and continue their prayers. If the bleeding goes past 39 days, then ghusl must be performed at the end of the 40 days.

Tips for Ghusl

Ghusl often gets difficult for newly weds who live in joint households. It may feel difficult to perform Ghusl at odd hours, but it is important to remember you are only fulfilling Allah’s commands and there is nothing to be embarrassed about.
There may be slight differences in how ghusl is performed in different madhabs.
While doing ghusl, be conscious of getting water in places that are usually missed for example under piercings, the belly button, armpits, etc.
title: Ghusl

text1:
The word Tayammum is an Arabic word that means “aiming.” Tayammum in Islam aims to purify one’s hands and face with soil to prepare for prayers. This might raise several questions for those who are entirely unaware of the teachings of the Qur’an and Sunnah regarding Tayammum.

In Surah An Nisa 4:43 Qur’an says:

  • …And if you are ill or on a journey or one of you comes from the place of relieving himself or you have contacted women [i.e., had sexual intercourse] and find no water, then look for clean earth and wipe over your faces and your hands [with it]. Indeed, Allah is most Merciful and Forgiving.”

The leniency of Allah almighty through such verses makes it clear that religion is not a tool for oppression and limitation. The teachings regarding Tayammum are not only given in Qur’an but our Prophet (ﷺ) showed Tayammum with his actions and advised other Muslims to do Tayammum given certain situations.

  • "Perform Tayammum with clean earth and that will be sufficient for you." (Sahih Bukhari: 348)

How to do Tayammum?

Just like the directions for wudu or ghusl (bathing), Islam has given teachings about the ways Tayammum can be done. To do Tayammum, one can follow a step-by-step procedure given below:

  • Strike both hands on the ground. Anything that you feel clingy on your hands should be shaken off.
  • Use both your hands to wipe your face while following the movements done during the wudu.
  • Don’t forget to wipe the cartilage of the upper ears.
  • Strike your hands to the ground a second time.
  • Wipe your left hand and arm with your right hand and vice-versa.
  • Wipe the inner side of the left hand with the right hand and the inner side of the left hand with the right hand.

In Islam, it is also believed that this kind of purification is a blessing from God. If you are at some place where it's prayer time and do not have water in your vicinity, then you can always opt for tayammum.

Tayammum can replace obligatory wudu or bathing under specific circumstances, which are discussed below:

1. Absence or Lack of Sufficient Water

The foremost reason for Tayammum is the absence of water or the water you have is insufficient for purification. For prayers and other practices in Islam, such as touching or reciting Quran, it is essential to purify yourself.

These practices are considered holy and should be done with complete hygiene. Tayammum is advised when it is time to pray and you do not have access to water. In such conditions, Qur’an and Sunnah have allowed performing Tayammum.

Also, if you are sure that you will not be able to access water till the time of prayers, then you can perform Tayammum for prayers.

2. During Journey

Travelling is part of our everyday life. In such a situation, one can get clean with the act of Tayammum. If someone cannot find water before prayer, he/she is allowed to do Tayammum.

The absence of water during the journey is also a condition for this ablution. Otherwise, in case there is the availability of water and one can perform wudu, then Tayammum is not advised.

3. Injury or Bad Health Condition

Illness or injury can be a reason for Tayammum. Individuals with poor health conditions are given much lenient ways for prayers. For purification before prayers, an ill or incapable individual can do Tayammum.

If one has a condition that exposure to water can compromise his/her health, then in such case, this way of purification is allowed.

4. Harmful Water

Given such a situation where there is the availability of water but can harm, then Islam allows you to do Tayammum. For example, if the water is cold enough to harm you and cannot be heated, then in this case, you can purify yourself through this procedure.

In Qur’an, Allah says:

  • "…Do not kill yourselves [or one another]. Indeed, Allah is to you ever Merciful." (Surah An-Nisa 4:29)

5. Saving Water

Islam understands and provides ways of convenience according to the needs of a human being. In this regard, one can perform Tayammum if the water is too little and only enough to use for survival, like cooking, making dough, or purifying something forgivable.

During the times of Muhammad (ﷺ), many companions would save their drinking water during journeys and do Tayammum for prayers.

6. Avoiding Danger

If reaching water and fetching it brings danger to the life of the one who wishes to purify himself/herself, then Tayammum is the answer. Such kind of situation can be faced by travelers. During journeys, it is not safe to leave your possessions to fetch water for wudu, which is why Islam advises purifying through Tayammum and protecting your property.

7. Uncertainty of Reaching Water

This condition for Tayammum is related to performing the prayers on time. If one is still deciding whether to get access to water for wudu on time, then he/she should go for Tayammum. This way, you will be able to perform your prayers on time.

On the other hand, if someone is confident that he/she will find access to water, then Tayammum can be avoided until the last minute. In this case, Tayammum can be delayed in getting access to water for either wudu or ghusl (Bathing).


Bottom Line

In case one is entirely sure about the unavailability of water, then it is recommended that he/she should do Tayammum at the beginning of time. Making oneself clean for obligatory practices such as prayers and recitation of the Qur’an is crucial.

The concept of Tayammum in Islam gives extensive knowledge about the importance of purification in Islam. Given certain conditions, Tayammum in Islam gives us a possible way of purification to practice our religion.

 

Written by Dur-e-Sabih
title: Tayammum

text1:
The word Wudu is an Arabic word that means “ablution.”  Wudu is the Islamic procedure for cleansing parts of the body, a type of ritual purification, or ablution. The four Fardh (Mandatory) acts of wudu are washing the face, then the arms, then wiping the head, then washing or wiping the feet, and doing these in order without any big breaks between them.

Wudu is an important part of ritual purity in Islam. It is governed by fiqh (Islamic jurisprudence), which specifies hygienical jurisprudence and defines the rituals that constitute it. Ritual purity is called tahara.

Wudu is typically performed before salah (daily ritual prayer). Activities that invalidate wudu include urination, defecation, flatulence, deep sleep, light bleeding (depending on madhhab), menstruation, postpartum status, and sexual intercourse.

Wudu is often translated as 'partial ablution', as opposed to ghusl 'full ablution' where the whole body is washed. It also contrasts with tayammum or "dry ablution", which uses sand or dust in place of water principally due to water scarcity or other harmful effects on the person.
title: About wudu
